current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

enrolled-dateline.#text:
Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and
			 fourteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: To provide for the transfer of naval vessels to certain foreign recipients, and for other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate

text.#text: This title  may be cited as the

header.#text: Transfer of naval vessels to certain foreign recipients

text.#text:
The President is authorized to transfer  to the Government of Mexico the OLIVER HAZARD PERRY class
			 guided missile frigates USS CURTS
			 (FFG–38) and USS MCCLUSKY (FFG–41) on a grant basis under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 516 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

text.#text:
The President is authorized to transfer the OLIVER HAZARD PERRY class guided missile frigates USS
			 TAYLOR (FFG–50), USS GARY (FFG–51), USS CARR (FFG–52), and USS ELROD
			 (FFG–55) to the Taipei Economic and Cultural Representative Office in the
			 United States (which is the Taiwan instrumentality designated pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 10(a) of the Taiwan Relations Act
section 21 of the Arms Export Control Act

header.#text: Transfer by sale to the Taipei Economic and Cultural Representative Office in the United States

text.#text:
Notwithstanding the authority provided in subsections (a) and (b) and  to transfer specific
			 vessels to specific countries, the President is authorized to transfer any
			 vessel named in this title to any country named in this section, subject
			 to the same conditions that would apply for such country under this
			 section, such that the total number of vessels transferred to such country
			 does not exceed the total number of vessels authorized for transfer to
			 such country by this section.

The value of a vessel transferred to another country on a grant basis pursuant to authority
			 provided by subsection (a)  shall not be counted against the
			 aggregate value of excess defense articles transferred in any fiscal year
			 under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 516 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

header.#text: Grants not counted in annual total of transferred excess defense articles

text.#text:
Any expense incurred by the United States in connection with a transfer authorized by this section
			 shall be charged to the recipient notwithstanding

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 516(e) of the
			 Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall require, as a condition of the transfer of a
			 vessel under this section, that the recipient to which the vessel is
			 transferred have such repair or refurbishment of the vessel as is needed,
			 before the vessel joins the naval forces of that recipient, performed at a
			 shipyard located in the United States.

text.#text: To the maximum extent practicable, the

header.#text: Repair and refurbishment in united states shipyards

text.#text:
The authority to transfer a vessel under this section shall expire at the end of the 3-year period
			 beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act.

header.#text: Transfer of excess United States naval vessels

text.#text: the Export Administration Regulations as maintained and amended under the authority of the

header.#text: Amendments relating to removal of major defense equipment from United States Munitions List

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 38(f) of the Arms Export Control Act

header.#text: Requirements for removal of major defense equipment from united states munitions list

text.#text:
Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the President shall take such actions as may be necessary
			 to require that, at the time of export or reexport of any major defense
			 equipment listed on the 600 series of the Commerce Control List contained
			 in Supplement No. 1 to part 774 of subtitle B of title 15, Code of Federal
			 Regulations, the major defense equipment will not be subsequently modified
			 so as to transform such major defense equipment into a defense article.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may authorize the transformation of any major defense equipment described in
			 subparagraph (A) into a defense article if the President—

text.#text:
determines that such transformation is appropriate and in the national interests of the United
			 States; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Foreign Affairs of the
			 House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: consistent with the notification requirements of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Foreign
			 Relations of the Senate

text.#text: provides notice of such transformation to the chairman of the

term.#tail: means an item designated by the President pursuant to subsection (a)(1).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as amended by this section, is further amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 38(f) of the Arms Export Control Act

header.#text:
Notification and reporting requirements for major defense equipment removed from united states
			 munitions list

text.#text:
The President shall ensure that any major defense equipment that is listed on the 600 series of the
			 Commerce Control List contained in Supplement No. 1 to part 774 of
			 subtitle B of title 15, Code of Federal Regulations, shall continue to be
			 subject to the notification and reporting requirements of the following
			 provisions of law:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 516(f) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961
Section 655 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961
Section 502B(d) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961
